title: 3D Animations
content:
Me and my cousin (KittYorp, for those who remember) are trying to find and learn a 3D animator... I dunno, she looked at Maya and couldn't figure it out. I remember Xtra made thoe 3D trophies for the 2004 awards, so if he could give me some advice.

And if anyone has any other tips, I would be all ears.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: 3D Animations
content:
Cool, I remember the name kittyorp. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Anyways, Maya can be quite complex I guess, if I've understood correctly it's one of the best tools and professionals use it. (I can be all wrong, though.) Thus, it's probably the most complex.

I have no experience on this field, but yeah, I assume xtra can give some useful tips when stoppin' by.[url=http://www.keengrid.net/]keengrid.net[/url]

title: Um...
content:
IMKO, I've tried some 3d programs;

Stay away from Game Studio; it basically stinks.

I'm in the proccess of figuring out if RealityFactory is worth my sweat (www.realityfactory.ca) - Free - If anybody else used/uses that program, advice and comentary would be nice.

I want to try 3dGameMaker, but need 2 know more
[url=http://t3dgm.thegamecreators.com/]t3dgm.thegamecreators.com/[/url] - $34 - U.S.A.

Um... I've tried Blender3d, but it was a bit confusing
[url=http://www.blender3d.org/cms/Home.2.0.html]www.blender3d.org/cms/Home.2.0.html[/url] - Open Scource

I'm also all ears...

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Um...
content:
I've tryed [url=http://www.anim8or.com/]Anim8or[/url], but I had no idea what to do. (Well, I knew how to make the basic shapes, but I didn't know how to form them into shapes (like helmets(I've tried to make Commander Keen with it, but that's all I tried to make with Anim8or)), and I didn't know how to add colors, or anytyhing else. Basically I just couldn't figure Anim8or out.(Those pictures in the gallery make it look easy to use, but it's definitely not easy to use!)) What a piece of junk Anim8or was!![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img] Signed, Harvey Smith
A proud member of the beta testing society
"I help entertain!" -Harvey
"I always try to consume interesting animals."-LevelLord

title: Re: 3D Animations
content:
If you want free 3d animation software you could try [url=http://www.artofillusion.org/]Art of Illusion[/url] or [url=http://blender.org/cms/Home.2.0.html]Blender3D[/url]. If you don't mind paying 3dsmax is excellent.

[quote]Quote:[hr]What a piece of junk Anim8or was!![hr][/quote]

Harvey, just because you couldn't figure out how to use it doesn't make it junk.

title: Re: 3D Animations
content:
(Try [url=http://www.3dbuzz.com/]3DBuzz[/url] for tutorials on Maya (and lots of other stuff).)Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: 3D Animations
content:
[url=http://www.3dtotal.com]www.3dtotal.com[/url] has nice tutorials on 3D. I used it for 3Ds max but there are tutorials for Maya. It's perfect for learning the basics, they are common for every 3D tool out there, but it has more complex tutorials too.

How much do you know about modelling in 3D? You can't start with animation if you didn't know how to create models first.

title: Re: 3D Animations
content: Maya's a difficult program to start out with, but it can be done (I started out with it).  What exactly do you want tips on?[url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]
